thread.title: Mother of British cycling champion found dead in Tuscan villa pool
thread.title_full: Mother of British cycling champion found dead in Tuscan villa pool - Telegraph

author: Alice Philipson , Rome
title: Mother of British cycling champion found dead in Tuscan villa pool
text: The mother of a British time trial cycling champion has been found dead in a swimming pool at her country home in Tuscany, Italy . Susan Vanessa Borradaile, 66, from Wokingham, was discovered by her husband in the early hours of Sunday morning after the pair returned home from eating out. It is understood he dived into the water, pulling her body from the pool, but was unable to save her. Ms Borradaile is the mother of former Team Sky cyclist Dario Cioni, who won the national time trial in 2004. She had lived in the hamlet of Pozzale, which is about 20 miles from Florence, for a number of years since leaving the UK. Team Sky cyclist Dario Cioni (Getty Images) The alarm was raised by Ms Borradaileâ€™s husband around 1.15am on Sunday. An ambulance crew and firefighters were sent to the scene but they were unable to revive her. The case has now been referred to the public prosecutor in Florence although there are not thought to be any suspicious circumstances. Ms Borradaile was well known in the village and highly regarded for her commitment to volunteering for the local parish. Her body has have been moved to Careggi University Hospital in Florence.
